Reviews.Title: “Good for the price..”
Reviews.Author: Andyfromchicago
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews written about this hotel are true. It is an okay hotel but not the best or even "good". You get the basics, and it is close to downtown and Hollywood. The room has a certain "old smell" and the bathroom seems like it was redone recently. The room and sheets seem to be out of date. It's true what they say, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Did not check tripadvisor .......wish I had!!!”
Reviews.Author: loveydoveyz
Reviews.Content: What a shame this hotel is not looked after, as it is in a good location! I will repeat other reviewers....funny smell in room and the carpet would have been nice when it was new!! along time ago!! Keep your shoes on! The cleaner keeps the bathrooms spotless however it must be a different cleaner for the bedrooms!! Dust is quite thick on the carpet around the edges and under the bed and tables!! bare wire for telephone lead also under bed. Thick dust clogging up aircon. Horrible marks on back of curtains and same mark inside lamps with thick dust on light bulbs. They have a stand for your case which has elastic straps across to support it however two were broken, they should just take it away it is useless!! Like everyone else we could hear people upstairs although other than that we didnt hear anything. I wouldn't stay or recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We cut our losses”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: Having prebooked a room we were disgusted with what we were given: dark and smelly (couldn't work out the unusual but horrible smell); the air conditioning didn't work and was covered with dust. The second room they gave us was only better by degrees (still smelly). The air conditioning worked but not effectively and it was really loud and also dusty. The door lock had been prised. We politely asked twice for a phone line out as our mobiles didn't work, but each time we were asked to wait 15-20 minutes. Eventually we cut our losses and left and went to a hotel we had passed in our taxi that had looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Shnnn is correct - not much to say.”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: Located on Wilshire west of Korea town; not a bad place, nothing great - dated furniture - appears to have had recent bathroom remodel (no mold or gunk evident in sliding bathtub doors). Carpet looks like its been there since opening. Sort of noisy, and definitely squeeky floors. Would recommend for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “good value in safe, nice area”
Reviews.Author: joiebutter
Reviews.Content: i just needed to stay in la one night and didn't want to fork out a lot of money. i came across Dunes Inn and thought i'd give it a shot. there is nothing fancy about the hotel but the rooms were clean, the bathrooms are recently remodeled and it's located in a very nice area so i felt comfortable walking around in the evening. i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with free parking”
Reviews.Author: pahmed
Reviews.Content: It is our first time in LA . I stayed there with my husband and my sone 1.5 years. We chose this hotel because it is free parking as we rented a car from San fransisco and we were staying there for 4 nights. The furniture was old, the walls is very thin, u can hear the people talking and moving around.It is safe. i found cameras in the parking and they monitered a car that was parking in the hotel and they were not guests from the Camera at night. It is a small hotel just for sleeping only, dont expect more than this.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel for the night we wanted it to be cheap. We found this hotel and knew it was close to where we would be headed for the evening we were there. We reviewed the reviews on the hotel and knew it wasn't going to be the best hotel but went with it anyways because of the value in cost. When we got into our room it was like an old 70's movie hotel room but with an updated bathroom. I thought the room was exactly like what I expected based on the reviews received but at the same time not as bad. It had a nice pool in the center and parking on site. Overall if I needed a cheap room in Los Angeles area again I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: zola_11
Reviews.Content: We were visiting my brother and tried to find a hotel close to his apartment. Walls were very thin and floorboards were VERY squeaky. There was a person pacing upstairs on those floorboards all night (!) and the squeaks would wake us up from sound sleep. Of course there were other noises that we did not want to subject our children to which were very easily heard through the walls!! This was so bad that we booked another hotel and forfeited our last night there just to get out as soon as possible. If you have children and/or want to sleep in peace and quiet, DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel, with updated bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: After a full day in LA, we found ourselves too exhausted to drive home, with nowhere to stay. The Ramada Wilshire Center had no vacancies, but we drove a little bit and stumbled upon Dunes Inn. The location was great for us, relatively close to the Wiltern Theater (not walking distance though), and the mostly residential neighborhood--Hancock Park--was quiet and safe. (By safe, I mean, the only entrance is manned by a watchful clerk; there are no vagrants around; nearby are expensive condos, houses, and a few churches; and I would feel comfortable walking around the block, though the streets are quite dark.) The bed was comfortable, but not luxurious. The tv worked fine. Best of all, the bathroom must have been recently renovated, because it was impeccably clean with a nice granite countertop and new tilework. There was a refrigerator, a pool in the atrium, wifi, and a few rooms with a small kitchen, but we didn't use these and can't comment. Since we didn't pay full price, the room was a really great deal. Parking was free and greatly appreciated; since the neighborhood is not within walking distance of restaurants, night life, etc., you'd want to visit with a car. As a side note, some nearby places to visit by car: charming Larchmont Village, Koreatown, Griffith Park & Observatory, Downtown/Japantown, and LACMA. To summarize, Dunes Inn Wilshire is like a Travelodge but with a fancier, cleaner bathroom, and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good ...”
Reviews.Author: Anygisi
Reviews.Content: The nightshift did Not Know Anything about our Reservation. He Gabe us a Small Room witsch smelled from the old carpet. No fridge, microwave or kettle. We cant recommend the Hotel. Too Bad because it is really Central and in a nice quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! awful! too bad because the Dunesuse to be decent!”
Reviews.Author: SirAries
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at The Dunes on every trip to LA. during the late 90's to about 2004. I'm very sad to say that this hotel has really gone down to the dogs. (I would however not even let my pet stay here) I was absolutely appalled with my room, even after getting another room which turned out to be even worse than the first. I was locked in due to the result of having my card charged, staying one night, when initially my stay was to be 3 nights. I slept with my clothes on INCLUDING my shoes, the carpet? OMG!! Sticky to my shoes. There is simply nothing pleasant to say about this property to date. Maybe back before my time, (I'm 50), she was majestic. But now this property is TIRED, TACKY, & TASTELESS. I highly recommend the Wilshire Plaza and the Ramada right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Clean”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Really the price is very, very low for LA and the neighborhood is very nice (Hancock Park) even if the hotel itself is budget. Dad came in from out of town without having reserved anywhere and he needed a place quick--he stayed here because it's as far away from a scary neighborhood as I could get. VERY basic but safe, clean and in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “It Worked in a Pinch”
Reviews.Author: RGD64
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a group of motorcyclists who found ourselves cruising the streets of LA late at night with no room reserved. We stumbled across the Dunes Inn - Wilshire. The clerk was friendly enough and accomodating. The room itself was small and some what outdated. It was reasonably comfortable and at $100 for three adults not over priced. I have come to expect a bit more however. We spent ten nights on the road in seven different states and this was the only hotel that did not have a coffee maker in the room nor was there coffee in the lobby the following morning. The nearest source for coffee was a 7-11 six blocks away. Over all the room worked in a pinch. I am unlikely to stay here again as I believe I can find a newer place with more amenities for a similar price in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad place”
Reviews.Author: Lepnor
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is good and the guy at the night shift did is best to help me. all other things was TERRIBLE. I was transferd from room to room 4 times (!) in the first room - the shower was broken, so i was moved.. then - the toilet was broken.. so i was transferd to another room. guess what? the bath was out of order... I would recomend finding another place, maybe a bigger hotel/motel network that you can count on...

Reviews.Title: “Not that great...”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: Well, I needed a place to stay in Los Angeles for a night. (I live in LA but needed a place to sleep near my office for a night). This place was REALLY close to my office. They have another location on Sunset that I drive by all the time. So I gave it a show. $80 something for the night. I have to say, the man behind the desk was HORRIBLE! He was behind a 3 inch thick bullet proof glass. Half the time, you couldnt hear a word he said. And he really wasnt happy working there (And I think he must be the owner) He has NO CLUE as to what he was doing. He made numerous errors and even tried to charge me for 2 nights when I was only staying one (He said I told him2 ) It was rough . A process that should have taken 10 minutes, ended up taking 35 minutes. The rooms were ok. Clean enough for the money. My advise, spend alittle more money and stay somewhere else... The are isnt great. Not very safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: lmarkman
Reviews.Content: A hundred dollars doesn't buy very much in accomodations in Los Angeles so the Dunes Wilshire is not a bad deal. The room was clean, everything worked and the staff was helpful. Surprisingly, although the motel is on a major thoroughfare, we were not at all bothered by street noises. The Dunes is located just a short drive from many major attractions. This part of Wilshire seems to be safe but you need to drive or take a bus to restaurants or shops. There is ample parking, a rarity in LA.

HotelInfo.Name: Dunes Inn - Wilshire
HotelInfo.Address: 4300 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90010
